8c0fe875-1131-47f6-a18f-0f8d72874ece: A nature mage loses access to arcanist's {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} list, and instead uses druid's spell list. His spells are still considered arcane spells, and use his {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier to determine the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of the spells and number of additional spells per day.
b991a953-03e2-4c4f-bd0b-e06bacfb4e1c: A phantasmal mage loses the ability to increase {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} of the next {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} using her arcane reservoir but instead gains a number of powerful metamagic abilities at 5th, 11th, and 17th levels.
70f6e5f7-d73d-449e-8133-eb0b92218d33: A white mage is an arcanist touched by a divine power and gifted with the ability to heal others.
42d87e5c-1da7-4cb1-8e8b-468c9dd3a252: After resting, an arcanist chooses a limited number of {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} to cast this day. They can cast the chosen spells in any combinations — the same one many times, or different ones, one time each.
78f4c9c6-43c3-4092-ad90-152ab5fef648:
An arcanist has an innate pool of magical energy that she can draw upon to fuel her arcanist exploits and enhance her {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. The arcanist's arcane reservoir can hold a maximum amount of magical energy equal to 3 + the arcanist's level. Each day, when preparing spells, the arcanist's arcane reservoir fills with raw magical energy, gaining a number of points equal to 3 + half her arcanist level. Any points she had from the previous day are lost. She can also regain these points through the consume spells class feature and some arcanist exploits. The arcane reservoir can never hold more points than the maximum amount noted above; points gained in excess of this total are lost.
Points from the arcanist reservoir are used to fuel many of the arcanist's powers. In addition, the arcanist can expend 1 point from her arcane reservoir as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g} whenever she casts an arcanist spell. If she does, she can choose to increase the {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} by 1 or increase the spell's {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} by 1. She can expend no more than 1 point from her reservoir on a given spell in this way.
ae85ce47-35b8-4e70-9163-b04e2863e4b8: An arcanist possesses an innate reservoir of arcane energy they can use for magical abilities and empowering their {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. Arcane reservoir points can be replenished by resting, or by sacrificing a prepared spell.
84f97a67-901c-4472-b888-e2e4e43ccb63: An eldritch font gains one additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} slot for each level of arcanist spell she can cast. However, the number of spells of each level that she can prepare reduces by 1. If this reduces her spells prepared for a level to 0, she still gains spell slots of that level, which can be used to cast spells using metamagic {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}.
e3499924-04df-427e-aba6-f3cbad1e3e19: An unlettered arcanist does not keep a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellbook{/g}. Instead, she gains a familiar in which she stores her spells as a witch does, though she does not gain a witch's patron. Treat her arcanist level as her witch level for determining the abilities and benefits granted by the familiar. Anything that would allow an unlettered arcanist to add spells to her spellbook allows her to add spells to her familiar instead.
9f9d2e7f-45f0-498a-8140-2b69beae5c21: An unlettered arcanist follows a different arcane tradition. She uses the witch {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} list instead of the wizard/sorcerer spell list.
6dd81832-86d9-469c-9b29-8406f32f2ef9: Arcanists are proficient with all {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}simple weapons{/g}. They are not proficient with any type of armor or shield. Armor interferes with an arcanist's gestures, which can cause her {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} with somatic components to fail.
d450dbdd-d4aa-499b-b1a4-c2f0e8c7e046: Arcanists are specialists of arcane magic. They apply a wide array of {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} that make them useful in a lot of different situations. After resting they choose a limited amount of spells they can use that day. Arcanists are capable of making their spells more powerful.
e576cb90-ea36-46f2-806d-851dc533efda: Arcanists can cast number of {g|Encyclopedia:Cantrips_Orisons}cantrips{/g}, or 0-level {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. These spells are cast like any other spell, but they do not consume spell slots.
87f926dc-b824-4f9b-a1b7-36dc70aebaa6: Arcanists learn exploits that let them duplicate simple {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} or effects of {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} by expending points of the arcane reservoir.
9da31dc4-daaa-4811-aec9-545cb6c6d9dc: Arcanists with an affinity for elemental forces sometimes focus on one and display its power in everything they do.
cce69aab-3b8d-4593-a504-79ed8503416f: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, the arcanist can expend 1 point from her arcane reservoir to create a barrier of magic that protects her from harm. This barrier grants the arcanist a number of temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} equal to her arcanist level + her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier, and lasts for 1 minute per arcanist level or until all the temporary hit points have been lost. Each additional time per day the arcanist uses this ability, the number of arcane reservoir points she must spend to activate it increases by 1 (up to a maximum of 3). The temporary hit points from this ability do not stack with themselves, but additional uses do cause the total number of temporary hit points and the duration to reset.
28bd3945-a6b5-43d3-8868-a29ee1c328b6: At 11th level and every 2 levels thereafter, an arcanist can choose one of the greater exploits in place of an arcanist exploit.
b1693f54-192d-4a95-8612-3bbbae4fde87: At 11th level, the phantasmal mage can spend 2 points from her arcane reservoir as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g} to make the next arcanist Illusion {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} she casts in 2 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} Persistent or Empowered, as per using the corresponding metamagic {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.
c0063b1f-b1c6-49f5-a429-148f64a6c0fe: At 13th level, an eldritch font can use her eldritch surge ability to force a creature to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}reroll{/g} a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} against one {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} or arcanist exploit and take the lower value. The eldritch font must declare the use of this ability before the result of that creature's saving throw is revealed. If the spell or arcanist exploit affects more than one target, only one target is affected by this ability.
f2290e8c-ca52-41ef-9c3c-a0b307c6e141: At 17th level, the phantasmal mage can spend 3 points from her arcane reservoir as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g} to make the next arcanist Illusion {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} she casts in 2 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} Maximized or 4 points to make it Quickened, as per using the corresponding metamagic {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.
5d718954-71cf-4304-b1c7-63324eb4bfbe: At 1st level, a white mage can expend 1 point from her arcane reservoir to use one of her {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} slots to cast a {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}cure{/g} spell (any spell with "cure" in its name) from the cleric spell list as if it were on her spell list and prepared. The spell must be of a level the arcanist can cast. At 10th level, the white mage can expend 5 points from her arcane reservoir and a spell slot of at least 5th level to cast breath of life.
aed909f2-8a29-45ef-89e9-90a57d8fa21d: At 1st level, an arcanist can expend an available arcanist {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} slot as a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}, making it unavailable for the rest of the day, just as if she had used it to cast a spell. She can use this ability a number of times per day equal to her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier (minimum 1). Doing this adds a number of points to her arcane reservoir equal to the level of the spell slot consumed. She cannot consume {g|Encyclopedia:Cantrips_Orisons}cantrips{/g} (0 level spells) in this way. Points gained in excess of the reservoir's maximum are lost.
5fc4ec8e-25c4-45e8-a9be-5247968800f9: At 1st level, the elemental master must select one element: air, earth, fire, or water. The arcanist can prepare one additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} per day of each level she can cast, but it must have the elemental descriptor of her chosen element. In addition, any spell she prepares from the opposite elemental school (air opposes earth, fire opposes water) takes up two of her prepared spell slots.
486d64db-af27-4c1d-a174-9472e3604750: At 20th level, once per day an eldritch font can spend a {g|Encyclopedia:Full_Round_Action}full-round action{/g} to refuel herself. Doing so allows her to prepare new {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and regain points of arcane reservoir equal to 1/2 her level.
c1584151-6426-4aaa-bb8e-cce59dfb485b: At 20th level, the arcanist learns how to convert her arcane reservoir into {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and back again. She can cast any spell she has prepared by expending a number of points from her arcane reservoir equal to the level of the spell to be cast instead of expending a spell slot.
2f412775-5635-4a7b-9ab6-f86dca780229: At 20th level, the brown-fur transmuter learns to fully master the power of transmutation. Whenever she casts a transmutation {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, it is treated as it were affected by the Extend Spell {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} without altering the {g|Encyclopedia:Casting_Time}casting time{/g} or slot used. Whenever she uses her powerful change ability, the {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} increases by 4 instead of 2. Her share transmutation ability can now target a willing creature within close range.
bb612921-6275-4f03-b446-b43252b6ead1: At 20th level, the cost of the phantasmal mage's metamagic abilities is reduced by 1 arcane pool point.
a4db8505-1c59-48b5-94c8-5f831ef2c4db: At 3rd level, an eldritch font can, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, pour more power into her {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and abilities. She can add 2 to the {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of a spell, or increase her effective arcanist level by 2 when using an arcanist exploit. She becomes fatigued upon using this ability. If she is already fatigued, she becomes exhausted. If she's already exhausted, she cannot use this ability. This ability does not stack with spending points from her arcane reservoir to increase the spell's caster level or DC (as the arcane reservoir class feature).
cc6ced98-161b-46a1-9d7b-45cfdf277f93: At 3rd level, the brown-fur transmuter learns to harness the power of her magic to empower her transmutations. Whenever the brown-fur transmuter casts a transmutation {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} using one of her arcanist spell slots, she can expend 1 point from her arcane reservoir as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g} to bolster the spell. If the spell grants a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to an {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g}, the bonus then increases by 2. The brown-fur transmuter cannot expend more than 1 point from her arcane reservoir in this way.
5f5fe0a6-4cdf-4e73-bcd9-cf0dd3657d54: At 5th level, the phantasmal mage can spend 1 point from her arcane reservoir as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g} to make the next arcanist Illusion {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} she casts in 2 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} Extended, Reach or Selective, as per using the corresponding metamagic {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.
90939a67-55c1-4e1f-8cd4-65c49de55f27: At 7th level, an eldritch font can use her eldritch surge ability to make two {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} associated with a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} and take the better result.
e3b840cd-4161-4eb1-8336-01db6e2169f9: At 9th level, an elemental master increases the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} done by her elemental {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}energy damage{/g} plus 1d8 points of damage per two arcanist levels she possesses. The type of damage is determined by the elemental attack.
27f7bd14-2153-4349-902e-bc4716a4b3fa: At 9th level, the brown-fur transmuter can target others with her transmutation {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. A brown-fur transmuter can expend 1 point from her arcane reservoir to change any transmutation spell with a range of personal to a range of {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch{/g}.
c4d2f5c6-7c32-4328-b4b3-24b79fbea054: By bending and sometimes even breaking the rules of magic, the arcanist learns to exploit gaps and exceptions in the laws of magic. Some of these exploits allow her to break down various forms of magic, adding their essence to her arcane reservoir. At 1st level and every 2 levels thereafter, the arcanist learns a new arcane exploit. An arcanist exploit cannot be selected more than once. Once an arcanist exploit has been selected, it cannot be changed. Most arcanist exploits require the arcanist to expend points from her arcane reservoir to function. Unless otherwise noted, the {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} for an arcanist exploit is equal to 10 + half the arcanist's level + the arcanist's {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier.
04699ff3-1e94-4530-b2fa-0d132b0e419c:
By expending 1 point from her arcane reservoir as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, the arcanist grants herself an effective illusion of armor.
She gains the benefits of mage armor {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} with a {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} that's equal to her arcanist level. If the arcanist already has mage armor active, she instead gains the benefits of shield of faith spell with a caster level equal to her arcanist level.
30f17223-8d9f-4a1c-8dae-0f22a5b9686c: By expending 1 point from her arcane reservoir, an arcanist can pull a veil of shadows around her, making her more difficult to spot and strike. The arcanist gains {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealment{/g} (20% miss chance) and a +5 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth checks{/g}. This effect lasts a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to 1 + the arcanist's {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} bonus.
82073329-07db-481c-9fd0-f75a7ec85796: For some arcanists, the power bubbling up from within is nearly too much to contain. They become adept at shaping this magical energy without needing to bind it up in {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}.
dfa71d0a-3644-47c1-b913-7da6195d11c4: Frequently called "brown-furs," these transmutation-focused arcanists are known for transforming themselves into animals. What few realize is that these specialized arcanists excel at turning themselves and others into all kinds of creatures.
01ddbfad-34af-4837-b97a-a84566a391ad: Some arcanists have innate abilities closely linked to nature. They use their {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} to dive deeper into the secrets of the world.
2a61eea5-f3be-42e3-9c12-5b4f2af7f36c: Some arcanists store their {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} as whispered secrets within familiars instead of on paper.
d941db03-8a0e-47ca-9817-eb34834d9865: Some {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasters{/g} seek the secrets of magic, pursuing the power to make the impossible possible. Others are born with magic in their blood, commanding unbelievable forces as effortlessly as they breathe. Yet still others seek to meld the science of arcane scholars with the natural might of innate casters. These arcanists seek to discover the mysterious laws of magic and through will and expertise bend those forces to their whims. Arcanists are the shapers and tinkers of the arcane world, and no magic can resist their control.
8c3fec93-c1bc-4ef5-ba6f-64dc6de8fb72: The arcanist can expend 1 point from her arcane reservoir as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}. If she does, the next arcanist {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} she casts in 2 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} will have increased {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} by 1 or increased {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} by 1. She can expend no more than 1 point from her reservoir on a given spell in this way.
de0dc757-7dd9-40c0-b39a-6f94b76aabdf: The arcanist can expend 1 point from her arcane reservoir to create a dimensional crack that she can step through to reach another location. This ability is used as a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}, allowing her to move to any location in close range she can see.
93c96232-23c0-4a1a-8169-37f5a655062b: The arcanist can grant herself {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier (minimum 1) as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} by expending 1 point from her arcane reservoir. This spell resistance is equal to 6 + her arcanist level.
fb254456-53c3-4d2c-8104-09d7b6bd4729: The arcanist can loose a deafening blast of sonic energy by expending 1 point from her arcane reservoir and succeeding at a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} against any one target within 30 feet. The blast deals an amount of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}sonic damage{/g} equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} + the arcanist's {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier, plus an additional 1d6 points of sonic damage for every 2 levels beyond 1st (to a maximum of 10d6 at 19th level). The target can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} to halve the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
4b338f35-aa44-4bfc-9cde-66e31d3439aa: The arcanist can protect herself from {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}energy damage{/g} as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} by expending 1 point from her arcane reservoir. She must pick one energy type and gains resistance 10 against that energy type for 1 minute per arcanist level. This protection increases by 5 for every 5 levels the arcanist possesses (up to a maximum of 30 at 20th level).
cbaf023d-ea48-4487-b6d5-7f3e02149833: The arcanist can unleash a blast of force by expending 1 point from her arcane reservoir. This {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} automatically strikes one target within 30 feet (as magic missile) and deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}force damage{/g}, plus 1 point of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per arcanist level. {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spells{/g} and effects that negate magic missile also negate this effect.
7e2a9dda-8dd8-49ac-8fbc-25499ee34083: The arcanist can unleash a freezing projectile by expending 1 point from her arcane reservoir and making a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} against any one target within 30 feet. If the {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} hits, it deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} + the arcanist's {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier, plus an additional 1d6 points of cold {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} for every 2 levels beyond 1st (to a maximum of 10d6 at 19th level). In addition, the target is staggered for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. It can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saving throw{/g} to negate the staggered condition.
8d470402-74ca-4c84-98ce-899f9b7d363e: The arcanist can unleash a jet of acid by expending 1 point from her arcane reservoir and making a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} against any one target in close range. If the {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} hits, it deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g} + the arcanist's {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier, plus an additional 1d6 points of acid {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} for every 2 levels beyond 1st (to a maximum of 10d6 at 19th level). The target is also sickened for 1d4 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}. It can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saving throw{/g} to negate the sickened condition.
00bfb89c-dfb8-4453-b2f2-fca19e2eba5c: The arcanist can unleash a jet of holy water by expending 1 point from her arcane reservoir. This creates a 30-foot line of water that deals {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} points of damage plus the arcanist's {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier, plus an additional 1d8 points of damage for every 2 levels beyond 1st (to a maximum of 10d8 at 19th level) to each target in the line that would normally take damage from holy water. Creatures in the area of effect can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} to halve the damage.
3945a449-33e3-4876-9f9c-db401e8e123e: The arcanist can unleash a lance of lightning by expending 1 point from her arcane reservoir and making a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} against any one target within 30 feet. If the {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} hits, it deals ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} + the arcanist's {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier) points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}electricity damage{/g}, plus 1d6 points of electricity {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} for every 2 levels beyond 1st (to a maximum of 10d6 at 19th level). The target's vision is also impaired, causing the target to treat all creatures as if they had {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealment{/g} (20%) for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. It can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saving throw{/g} to negate the impaired vision.
b5750f8f-dae8-4066-992c-e8262e155266: The arcanist can unleash an arc of flame by expending 1 point from her arcane reservoir. This creates a 30-foot line of flame that deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} + the arcanist's {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier, plus an additional 1d6 points of fire {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} for every 2 levels beyond 1st (to a maximum of 10d6 at 19th level) to each target in the line. Creatures in the area of effect may attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} to halve the damage.
4a745c54-23ed-4f4e-98a5-5c06927aefc4: The arcanist can use the consume {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} class feature or the consume magic items exploit as {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift actions{/g} instead of as {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move actions{/g}.
aff3fba6-1488-45b1-bbe7-7b2eb192b1fe: The arcanist gains a +2 natural armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} N/{g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}slashing{/g}, where N is equal to her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier (minimum 1). While this ability is in effect, she counts as both her original creature type and a plant creature for the purpose of abilities and {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}.
a5e9c8fb-d930-4f61-9ad6-9af051356f59: The arcanist infuses herself with the toughness of the plant life that she studies. The arcanist can spend 1 point from her arcane reservoir to gain a +2 natural armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} N/{g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}slashing{/g} where N is equal to her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier (minimum 1), for 1 minute per arcanist level. While this ability is in effect, she counts as both her original creature type and a plant creature for the purpose of abilities and {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}.
a40127b6-a493-4d54-a269-b609a4b309c1: The strong bond with fairies determines a natural predisposition of gnomes to the magic of the First World. By sacrificing time to learn the modern arcanist techniques, phantasmal mages become true masters of metamagic when it comes to the school of illusion.
313e462e-bfbd-46a2-83e2-c4cc596ee3f6: The target's vision is impaired, causing the target to treat all creatures as if they had {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealment{/g} (20%) for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
ce03b307-fa81-47cd-b5d3-4ea2ab988762: This exploit works as the acid jet exploit, but the arcanist needs to expend 2 points from her arcane reservoir instead of one. If she does, the target takes additional {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} on the following {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} if it fails its {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g}. The target takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g} on the following round for every 2d6 points of acid damage dealt by the initial {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. On subsequent rounds, the target continues to take 1d6 points of acid damage for every 2d6 points of acid damage dealt on the previous round. The damage continues until the amount of acid damage dealt on the previous round by this effect is 1d6. For example, a 9th level arcanist would deal (5d6 + {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier) points of acid damage, 2d6 points of acid damage on the following round, and 1d6 points of acid damage on the third and final round. The arcanist must have the acid jet exploit to select this exploit.
fc8f3ace-da88-4f5b-9f37-c76f59b038b9: This exploit works as the flame arc exploit, but the arcanist needs to expend 2 points from her arcane reservoir instead of one. If she does so, half of the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} she deals is fire, and the other half results directly from unholy power that is not subject to fire resistance. Good creatures that take damage from a hellfire ray must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saving throw{/g} or be sickened for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}.
a905dc0a-c804-46b7-bec9-2e385f50533b: This exploit works as the flame arc exploit, but the arcanist needs to expend 2 points from her arcane reservoir instead of one. If she does, each target catches on fire if it fails its {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g}. Until the fire is extinguished, the target takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}3d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} at the start of each of its turns. The target can attempt a Reflex every {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} to extinguish the flames.
1efe8497-26c4-46cb-99e4-7885d3e38ccf: This exploit works as the ice missile exploit, but the arcanist needs to expend 2 points from her arcane reservoir instead of one. If she does, the target is coated in rime if it fails its {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g}. As long as the ice remains (1 minute per level), the target is entangled and takes 1 point of {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}Dexterity damage{/g} at the start of each of its turns. The target tries to break free from the ice every {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} by making a {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} with a {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} equal to 10 + the arcanist's {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. If the target takes {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g}, the ice melts and the effect ends. The arcanist must have the ice missile arcanist exploit to select this exploit.
80605248-4b43-4f27-b9c0-52838f17e636: This exploit works as the lightning lance exploit, but the arcanist needs to expend 2 points from her arcane reservoir instead of one. If she does, all creatures adjacent to the target take an amount of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} equal to half the amount of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}electricity damage{/g} rolled. Adjacent creatures can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} to halve this damage. Whether or not the target makes its saving throw has no effect on adjacent targets. The arcanist must have the lightning lance exploit to select this exploit.
3c13dd71-0d76-47fb-a1c0-c2eded2b9bbc:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} cures {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}5d8{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} + 1 point per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum +25).
Unlike other spells that {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} damage, breath of life can bring recently slain creatures back to life. If cast upon a creature that has died within 2 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}, apply the healing from this spell to the creature. If the healed creature's hit point total is at a negative amount less than its {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} score, it comes back to life and stabilizes at its new hit point total. If the creature's hit point total is at a negative amount equal to or greater than its Constitution score, the creature remains dead. Creatures brought back to life through breath of life gain a temporary negative level that lasts for 1 day.
Creatures slain by {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}death{/g} effects cannot be saved by breath of life.
Like cure spells, breath of life deals damage to undead creatures rather than curing them, and cannot bring them back to life.
d932993b-053c-4b8f-a7ce-22f4fdf133d4: When laying your hand upon a living creature, you channel positive energy that cures {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} + 1 point per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum +5). Since undead are powered by negative energy, this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} deals damage to them instead of {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}curing{/g} their wounds.[LONGSTART] An undead creature can apply {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g}, and can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} to take half damage.[LONGEND]

76c08a31-6047-4573-b167-2cf8b7a5b675: Whenever the arcanist expends 1 point from her arcane reservoir to increase the {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} of a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, the caster level increases by 2 instead of 1. Whenever she expends 1 point from her arcane reservoir to increase the spell's {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g}, it increases by 2 instead of 1.
40558f7a-0f7c-4427-ad2d-7c16331596d6: Whenever the arcanist uses the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} exploit, the spell resistance is equal to 11 + the arcanist's level. The arcanist must have the spell resistance exploit to select this exploit.
b7c70440-2e25-4f4e-8917-d2a3ac8bf4b7: You channel positive energy to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}cure{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} + 1 point per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum +25) on each creature in the radius. Like other cure {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, mass cure light wounds deals damage to undead in its area rather than curing them.
